channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Vance and Walz both claim the Midwest. What does it mean to be Midwestern?
item.description: While vice presidential candidates tout their Midwestern roots Ayesha talks to author Jon Lauck about what's Midwestern.
item.content:encoded: While vice presidential candidates tout their Midwestern roots Ayesha talks to author Jon Lauck about what's Midwestern.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: Harris inches ahead in the polls amidst swing state campaigning
item.description: Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harris and her running mate Tim Walz complete their five-state introductory tour. Harris is gaining in the polls.
item.content:encoded: Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harris and her running mate Tim Walz complete their five-state introductory tour. Harris is gaining in the polls.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: The world's oldest solar calendar may have been unearthed in Turkey
item.description: Researchers say an ancient calendar discovered in southern Turkey may also memorialize a devastating comet strike that hit Earth nearly 13,000 years ago.
item.content:encoded:
Researchers say an ancient calendar discovered in southern Turkey may also memorialize a devastating comet strike that hit Earth nearly 13,000 years ago.

(Image credit: Ozan Kose)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: The U.S. is bracing for an Iranian response to the killing of a senior Hamas leader
item.description: NRR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks to Firas Maksad, the Middle East Institute, about a potential Iranian response to the killing of a Hamas leader in Tehran.
item.content:encoded: NRR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks to Firas Maksad, the Middle East Institute, about a potential Iranian response to the killing of a Hamas leader in Tehran.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: In Ferguson, some businesses destroyed during the 2014 protests are still rebuilding
item.description: The police killing of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo., a decade ago led to violent protests that left many businesses destroyed. Efforts to revitalize the area since then have yielded mixed results.
item.content:encoded: The police killing of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo., a decade ago led to violent protests that left many businesses destroyed. Efforts to revitalize the area since then have yielded mixed results.
item.dc:creator: Eric Schmid

item.title: Amateur runners will get the chance to compete on the same course as Olympic athletes
item.description: One of the last events of the Sumer Olympics is always the marathon. This year's was a little different. After the official entrants ran the course, it was opened to regular runners.
item.content:encoded: One of the last events of the Sumer Olympics is always the marathon. This year's was a little different. After the official entrants ran the course, it was opened to regular runners.
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: Harris picks her running mate and other political news, from the newsmakers themselves
item.description: We listen back to statements and slogans from the campaign trail.
item.content:encoded: We listen back to statements and slogans from the campaign trail.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: Worms are infecting Colorado's sweet corn. Moths with STDs could help
item.description: Colorado corn growers are testing a variety of new methods to combat the spread of moths, including a sexually transmitted virus that makes the insect's offspring infertile.
item.content:encoded: Colorado corn growers are testing a variety of new methods to combat the spread of moths, including a sexually transmitted virus that makes the insect's offspring infertile.
item.dc:creator: Eric Whitney

item.title: A lesser-known aspect of Trump rallies: they all begin with prayer
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe talks with McKay Coppins, staff writer at The Atlantic magazine. He's looked at one element of Donald Trump's rallies that doesn't get much scrutiny: the introductory prayers.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe talks with McKay Coppins, staff writer at The Atlantic magazine. He's looked at one element of Donald Trump's rallies that doesn't get much scrutiny: the introductory prayers.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: 80 years ago, Smokey Bear taught Americans about fire safety. Is he still relevant?
item.description: The famous symbol of fire prevention turns 80. But fire ecologists say that his message is outdated.
item.content:encoded: The famous symbol of fire prevention turns 80. But fire ecologists say that his message is outdated.
item.dc:creator: Eric Whitney
